verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> to<WH5921> Jeduthun,<WH3038> A Psalm<WH4210> of Asaph.<WH623> I cried<WH6817> unto<WH413> God<WH430> with my voice,<WH6963> even unto<WH413> God<WH430> with my voice;<WH6963> and he gave ear<WH238> unto<WH413> me.

In the day<WH3117> of my trouble<WH6869> I sought<WH1875> the Lord:<WH136> my sore<WH3027> ran<WH5064> in the night,<WH3915> and ceased<WH6313> not:<WH3808> my soul<WH5315> refused<WH3985> to be comforted.<WH5162>
I remembered<WH2142> God,<WH430> and was troubled:<WH1993> I complained,<WH7878> and my spirit<WH7307> was overwhelmed.<WH5848> Selah.<WH5542>
Thou holdest<WH270> mine eyes<WH5869> waking:<WH8109> I am so troubled<WH6470> that I cannot<WH3808> speak.<WH1696>
I have considered<WH2803> the days<WH3117> of old,<WH4480> <WH6924> the years<WH8141> of ancient times.<WH5769>
I call to remembrance<WH2142> my song<WH5058> in the night:<WH3915> I commune<WH7878> with<WH5973> mine own heart:<WH3824> and my spirit<WH7307> made diligent search.<WH2664>
Will the Lord<WH136> cast off<WH2186> forever?<WH5769> and will he be favorable<WH7521> no<WH3808> more?<WH3254> <WH5750>
Is his mercy<WH2617> clean gone<WH656> forever?<WH5331> doth his promise<WH562> fail<WH1584> forevermore?<WH1755> <WH1755>
Hath God<WH410> forgotten<WH7911> to be gracious?<WH2589> hath he in anger<WH639> shut up<WH7092> his tender mercies?<WH7356> Selah.<WH5542>
And I said,<WH559> This<WH1931> is my infirmity:<WH2470> but I will remember the years<WH8141> of the right hand<WH3225> of the most High.<WH5945>
I will remember<WH2142> the works<WH4611> of the LORD:<WH3050> surely<WH3588> I will remember<WH2142> thy wonders<WH6382> of old.<WH4480> <WH6924>
I will meditate<WH1897> also of all<WH3605> thy work,<WH6467> and talk<WH7878> of thy doings.<WH5949>
Thy way,<WH1870> O God,<WH430> is in the sanctuary:<WH6944> who<WH4310> is so great<WH1419> a God<WH410> as our God?<WH430>
Thou <WH859> art the God<WH410> that doest<WH6213> wonders:<WH6382> thou hast declared<WH3045> thy strength<WH5797> among the people.<WH5971>
Thou hast with thine arm<WH2220> redeemed<WH1350> thy people,<WH5971> the sons<WH1121> of Jacob<WH3290> and Joseph.<WH3130> Selah.<WH5542>
The waters<WH4325> saw<WH7200> thee, O God,<WH430> the waters<WH4325> saw<WH7200> thee; they were afraid:<WH2342> the depths<WH8415> also<WH637> were troubled.<WH7264>
The clouds<WH5645> poured out<WH2229> water:<WH4325> the skies<WH7834> sent out<WH5414> a sound:<WH6963> thine arrows<WH2671> also<WH637> went abroad.<WH1980>
The voice<WH6963> of thy thunder<WH7482> was in the heaven:<WH1534> the lightnings<WH1300> lightened<WH215> the world:<WH8398> the earth<WH776> trembled<WH7264> and shook.<WH7493>
Thy way<WH1870> is in the sea,<WH3220> and thy path<WH7635> in the great<WH7227> waters,<WH4325> and thy footsteps<WH6119> are not<WH3808> known.<WH3045>
Thou leddest<WH5148> thy people<WH5971> like a flock<WH6629> by the hand<WH3027> of Moses<WH4872> and Aaron.<WH175>
